Convert Data of class MSnSet to pmartR pepData Class

Source: R/MSnSet2pepData.R
MSnSet2pepData.Rd

Converts an object of class MSnSet to an object of the class 'pepData'

MSnSet2pepData(
  msnset_object,
  data_scale,
  edata_cname = "UniqueID",
  fdata_cname = "SampleID",
  emeta_cname = "UniqueID",
  check.names = TRUE
)

Arguments

msnset_object

is an object of class MSnSet, it stores quantification data and meta data. Creating an MSnSet object is described in the MSNbase package io vignette.

data_scale

Scale of the data provided in e_data. Acceptable values are 'log2', 'log10', 'log', and 'abundance', which indicate data is log base 2, base 10, natural log transformed, and raw abundance, respectively.

edata_cname

character string specifying the name of the column containing the peptide identifiers in e_data and e_meta (if applicable).

fdata_cname

character string specifying the name of the column containing the sample identifiers in f_data.

emeta_cname

character string specifying the name of the column containing the protein identifiers (or other mapping variable) in e_meta (if applicable).

Value

pepData object

Examples

if (FALSE) {
library(pmartR)
library(MSnbase)
data("msnset")
result = MSnSet2pepData(msnset,
                        data_scale = "log2",
                        edata_cname = "UniqueID",
                        fdata_cname = "SampleID",
                        emeta_cname = "UniqueID",
                        check.names = TRUE)
}
